node.statement: (BG concentration inequality for the enhanced Phi^4_3 data) The Barashkov-Gubinelli (2020) variational construction implies sub-Gaussian concentration for Lipschitz functionals of the enhanced Phi^4_3 data. Specifically: let X = C^{-1/2-delta} x C^{-1-delta} x C^{-3/2-delta} be the enhanced data space, equipped with any of the equivalent product Besov norms. The BG construction represents the enhanced data under mu as (phi, :phi^2:, :phi^3:) = Psi(X, u*) where X is the GFF (Gaussian), u* is the optimizer in the Boue-Dupuis formula, and Psi is the Wick power lifting. The resulting measure mu on X inherits concentration from the Gaussian structure. Concretely: for any L-Lipschitz functional F: X -> R (with respect to the product Besov norm), mu satisfies P_mu(|F - M_F| > t) <= C exp(-c t^2/L^2) for all t > 0, where M_F is a median (or mean) of F under mu and C, c > 0 are universal constants depending only on the LSI/concentration constant of mu. This sub-Gaussian concentration follows from the log-Sobolev inequality for mu. The LSI for Phi^4_3 on T^3 is established by combining: (i) the Barashkov-Gubinelli (2020) variational representation, (ii) the Polchinski RG flow analysis which gives uniform spectral gap/LSI for the finite-dimensional approximations, and (iii) passage to the continuum limit. The LSI constant C_LS is finite and depends on (lambda, m^2, |T^3|) but not on any UV cutoff.
